page.title: 03Quarrying
page.content: The limestone hills around the villages of Cauldon and Cauldon Lowe are the source of material for the extractive industries of our area. The Tarmac Quarry is the largest single employer with about 100 employees, most of whom work full time. The main product, limestone is used for making roads, wall building, landscaping, lime-spreading on farms and for making plastics. The stone is quarried by a combination of explosives and large dragline excavators, then taken by giant earth movers to the processing plant on site. From there fleets of lorries and goods trains transport it all round the country. A few years ago stone from this quarry was used to build the Thames Flood Barrier. Now stone is being used for landscaping at the National Garden Centre, Stoke-on-Trent.
